intro: Polygala paganuccii, commonly known as the Paganucci's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae, which includes over 700 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and clusters of small, often yellow or greenish flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
